body:
> Let's add a test that asserts a desirable log format.

Done

Please check the correctness of the jira issue number in the PR heading. It looks like it is incorrect. [IGNITE-13021](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IGNITE-13021) is about the new SQL engine, not about the connectivity.

> Please check the correctness of the jira issue number in the PR heading. It looks like it is incorrect. [IGNITE-13021](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IGNITE-13021) is about the new SQL engine, not about the connectivity.

Fixed on IGNITE-13012. Thanks!
@alamar Thank you, I have updated the PR.
@dehasi try to revisit next week

Hello! Thanks for the PR.
Let's make the following changes:

1. core module should contain all implementations and interfaces that required to:
  a. Collect profiling data.
  b. Iterate through profiling data from disk
2. html report generation should be in ignite-extension as a separate module.
3. please, create the ticket to provide ability to profile only specific operations. Something like `profiling.enable(TRANSACTION, CACHE_OPERATIONS)`
@dehasi PR is merged
Merged to master branch.
Looks good to me.
@sergey-chugunov-1985 , I find you have good experience in TcpDiscoverySpi. Could you take a look at this ticket too?

Hello @Mmuzaf,

Could you please describe the issue in detail? Why did you think that the number of client nodes is the root cause of the issue? Did you see long GC pauses or something related to this?

In general, I agree that 150 client nodes look too big for the test, but, on the other hand, we should be sure that we don't hide the real cause of this failure.

Thanks,
S.
@anton-vinogradov Could you please have a look?

@anujajakhade Could you please provide additional info on what this fix for?
@Mmuzaf, @ptupitsyn, could you please check the changes?
Can you please rebase this branch properly, so that it contains only your changes?

It seems to me that work "profiling" not clear enough.
"Profiling" is a process that can be done with the data that will be collected with the patch.
But, "profiling" is not a single use-case for the data.
I can imagine something like automatic parameters tuning, affinity function tweaks, etc. based on the data about performance.

I propose to use "Performance statistics" or similar words to describe the new feature and "performance report" to name report based on collected data.

WDYT?
What happens when C++ thin client, C# thin client, Python thin client, etc, encounter such BinaryObject's? Do you have tests? What is your plan here? Will they be unaffected?
I must admit that I do not know. I would need the help of someone more knowledgeable about these clients
Could we create an XML checkstyle for IDEA or something else to make automatic refactoring?

@zaleslaw If you setup IDEA equal to [screenshot](https://yadi.sk/i/kyXSE5rDc3ePOA) then it will automatically rearrange imports according to codestyle(Code -> Optimize imports). All new imports will goes to the right place, also.

So, I agree, but for newcomers it's a good point to have automatic
checkstyle with all possible rules. I had one a year ago, but it doesn't
cover all cases.
If you have one, please let me know

вт, 30 июн. 2020 г. в 17:51, Nikolay <notifications@github.com>:

> @zaleslaw <https://github.com/zaleslaw> If you setup IDEA equal to
> screenshot <https://yadi.sk/i/kyXSE5rDc3ePOA> then it will automatically
> rearrange imports according to codestyle(Code -> Optimize imports). All new
> imports will goes to the right place, also.
>

> .

@zaleslaw We have automation in the form of maven `checkstyle` profile. The goal of this PR is to extend the coverage of automatic checks with the automatic Import Order rule. AFAIK checkstyle+maven is common solution and used in many other open-source projects.

Do you have in mind some other kind of automation?

No automation, maybe it sounds wrong earlier: I suggest only shared
community checkstyle.xml for using in IDEA (somebody shared one with me a
few year ago, but now I lost it after moving on another laptop)

We have this file and it updated in PR. 
Changes in settings.xml is the essence of PR

Great, look like I missed the xml and saw only reordered  imports  in files

@nizhikov I see that travis build check failed and it seems that it is related to the import order rule (https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/ignite/builds/703548289?utm_source=github_status&utm_medium=notification). Could you please take a look?

👍  it was failing for me as well, made changes to dockerfile  https://github.com/ravishtiwari/ignite/commit/bfe80582e7b899bbc5420b85ec62b847666bb93c 
and wanted to raise my first pr for ignite :( 

but, this is already fixed, should be merged.
fixed
@Mmuzaf should we close the PR as snapshots are merged to master?
I think this means the behavior should be off by default, to be enabled explicitly.
Oh, I can see that you already have the configuration setting implemented. Sorry.

> @Mmuzaf should we close the PR as snapshots are merged to master?

Sure, I've closed the PR.
Like
Do we have a test to cover the scenario when cache created and started from static configuration `IgniteConfiguration#setCacheConfiguration`?
Do we have test for a `SCAN` query?

> Do we have test for a `SCAN` query?

Yes. See PerformanceStatisticsQueryTest#testScanQuery()
Closing. We don't need this now we have CMake build scripts (#7956)
Let's add tests to check tracking of `INSERT` and `UPDATE` queries.

Stephen,

I'm afraid we can't merge this change until Ignite 3.0 because it breaks backward compatibility. There are already might be many applications that use this API and execute the service on all the nodes purposefully. Let's wait until Ignite 3.0 is put on rails.
Stephen, thanks for the contribution!
Thanks for the contribution, I've merged the changes to the master branch!

Hi Team,

Can you plz review this PR?

Let's add `IgniteScheduler` and remove TODO in `SandboxIgniteComponentProxy` and add scheduler test to `IgniteOperationsInsideSandboxTest`.
